metadata.title: CVE-2015-7984 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities in Horde before5.2.8, Horde Groupware before 5.2.11, and Horde Groupware Webmail Editionbefore 5.2.11 allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication ofadministrators for requests that execute arbitrary (1) commands via the cmdparameter to admin/cmdshell.php, (2) SQL queries via the sql parameter toadmin/sqlshell.php, or (3) PHP code via the php parameter toadmin/phpshell.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7984` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-horde - 5.2.9+debian01build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php-horde package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.9+debian01build1').
